node.title: 'You've got to risk it for the biscuit': Is equity crowdfunding worth the risk?
node.description: First-time investors are pouring millions of dollars into unlisted start-ups and small-to-medium-sized businesses through online crowdfunding campaigns. But is it really a smart way to invest?Â
node.content:
["When non-alcoholic craft beer company Sobah needed cash to expand, they turned to equity crowdfunding.", "The Indigenous-owned company raised $1 million from 580 investors.\u00a0 \u00a0", "\"It's a range of people, from a whole bunch of different backgrounds.\u00a0We got a good handful of First Nations peoples who have signed up to be an owner, which is awesome,\" says Sobah business owner Clinton Schultz.\u00a0", "
What is equity crowdfunding?
", "Equity crowdfunding \u2014\u00a0or equity crowd-sourced funding \u2014\u00a0is when unlisted start-ups or small-to-medium-sized companies raise money through a licensed equity crowdfunding platform.", "It's been\u00a0legal since 2018 and there are now 15 platforms with financial services licences.\u00a0", "The platforms must run some checks on interested companies and they make their money by charging eligible businesses fees and a commission, which is a percentage of the funds raised.\u00a0", "Companies can raise a maximum of $5 million a year. Retail investors can contribute as little as $50 or a maximum of $10,000 per company in exchange for a proportional shareholding in the business.", "There is a five-day cooling-off period if you change your mind.\u00a0", "Funds can be raised from\u00a0an unlimited number of investors who usually contribute small amounts of money in exchange for a proportional shareholding.\u00a0", "If the campaign target is not reached, the money is returned to investors.\u00a0 \u00a0", "\"There's essentially two game-changers,\" says Birchal co-founder Matt Vitale, which is one of the biggest platforms.\u00a0 \u00a0\u00a0", "\"The first is that a Proprietary Limited Company can now\u00a0have an unlimited number of investors.", "\"Whereas, previously, you'd need to convert to a public structure once you've got over 50 shareholders.\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0\u00a0", "\"And the second is that we can advertise these offers online, so social media, email, anything really. It's really exciting.\"", "", "
Sobah co-owner Clinton Schultz says equity crowdfunding is a way for a broader range of investors to get a stake in a business they believe in.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "The hype around equity crowdfunding is growing. Last financial year, Australian platforms raised a combined $46 million, according to an industry report by licence holder Equitise.", "That's\u00a0a 125 per cent increase on the previous 12 months.", "Recently eco-cleaning product company Zero Co raised $6 million in just six hours.\u00a0", "Globally, the industry is worth around $2 billion,\u00a0according The Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance.\u00a0\u00a0", "The United Kingdom and the United States were the\u00a0biggest markets for equity crowdfunding in 2020, while Australia ranked seventh.", "A\u00a0lower investment threshold \u2014 investing in a publicly listed company will set you back a minimum of $500 \u2014\u00a0and slick marketing campaigns\u00a0mean\u00a0equity crowdfunding is attracting a lot of\u00a0first-time investors.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "\"There are a number of groups of investors out there, like the millennials, who are looking for something different,\u00a0rather than\u00a0traditional investment options,\" says PwC\u00a0financial services leader Tom Gunson.\u00a0", "\"And that is attractive to them, because it does allow them to specifically align\u00a0their purpose or values to [those of] small-to-mid-sized companies.\"", "
What do investors get out of it?
", "", "
Becky Smallchua and her husband invested $20,000 in cosmetics business Kester Black\u00a0(ABC News: Kyle Harley)
", "Becky Smallchua is one of 1,600 investors who raised $2 million for ethical cosmetics brand Kester Black.\u00a0", "The business will use the cash to scale-up and expand into new export markets.", "\"They're leading in the beauty industry, changing up the way things are done, using business as a force for good. And that's something that my both my husband and I really believe in,\" she says.\u00a0", "About half of Kester Black's investors contributed the campaign's minimum amount of $250, and 70 per cent of those who contributed to the campaign are women.\u00a0", "\"And they're literally just customers, loyal followers of the brand. We had a couple of high net worth [individuals who] came in, but we didn't know them, they are also customers of the brand,\" says Kester Black owner Anna Ross.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
Kester Black raised $2million from mostly female investors.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "None of the companies that have raised cash through equity crowdfunding have delivered a return to investors yet.\u00a0", "\"We told everybody before we did the raise that they would not be getting dividends for at least the next five years. So they are supporting us, they get to feel really good about it,\" Anna says.", "In the shorter term, Kester Black investors receive\u00a0product and vouchers, and will be\u00a0included in product development.", "However, Tom Gunson says, not all businesses will\u00a0bring investors into the decision-making process.\u00a0", "\"As a crowdfunder, you have no or little influence over the management of the company. And, therefore, effectively what they choose to use their funding for, and how long and where they direct it, is\u00a0pretty much up to [the company's]\u00a0direction.\"", "Investors who back the next big company could find themselves cashed up if a takeover occurs or it is listed on the stock exchange.\u00a0", "
What are the risks?
", "Equity crowdfunding is considered a high-risk investment. That's because start-ups and less established businesses have a higher failure rate.\u00a0", "While crowdfunding platforms are required to run checks to a \"reasonable\" standard if fraud or insolvency occurs, you may not be able to get your money back.", "", "
Dr Angel Zhong says equity crowdfunding is a high-risk form of investing.\u00a0(ABC News: Peter Drought)
", "Dr Angel Zhong, a senior finance lecturer at RMIT University, says you should be prepared to lose your entire investment.\u00a0", "Although equity crowdfunding platforms are required by law to explain the risks, Angel is not convinced that all retail investors take notice of the warnings.\u00a0", "\"You\u00a0need to do your due diligence, do as much research as you can. Look at the business model, find out what they're going to use your money for.\u00a0And, second, be realistic about the chances of winning.\"", "And, even if the company is successful, the value of your investment \u2014 and any return on that\u00a0investment \u2014 could be diluted\u00a0if the company issues more shares.\u00a0", "Because there is no secondary market \u2014 such as\u00a0buying shares in a publicly listed company \u2014\u00a0you may not be able to sell your shares quickly, or at all.\u00a0", "Some of equity crowdfunding's early success stories have not worked out.", "Female rideshare company Shebah, which raised $3 million in 2019, is in voluntary administration.", "The company is seeking a sale or a restructure after losing money during COVID-19 lockdowns.\u00a0", "Neobank Xinja\u00a0collapsed in December after raising $5 million in two equity crowdfunding raisings.\u00a0\u00a0", "Kai Ansaari maxed out his retail investment cap and put\u00a0$10,000 into Xinja after first hearing about the\u00a0fundraising campaign through platform Equitise.", "\"I am disappointed,\u00a0I've lost money.\"", "Since Xinja's collapse,\u00a0Kai\u00a0has\u00a0invested in medicinal cannabis company CDA Health's equity crowdfunding raise,\u00a0albeit a much smaller amount of $500.\u00a0", "\"$10,000 isn't a small amount of money. But, you know, you've got to risk it for the biscuit, which is probably not what a sophisticated investor would say,\" Kai\u00a0says.\u00a0", "\"The big lesson for me is really just capital allocation. So how big do you go? What sort of size depending on the risk? So and that's something I think that Mum\u00a0or Dad investors probably need to understand. You don't go all in,\" Kai says.", "", "
Sobah plans to triple the production of its non-alcoholic craft beer(Supplied)
", "While acknowledging the risks for investors, those involved in equity crowdfunding argue it democratises capital-raising for businesses and investors: You don't need to have wealthy connections or be rich to get involved.", "\"Investment can be tricky. And it can be difficult and [it] can be expensive, not just [for people]\u00a0wanting to invest, but also being a company or being a small entity that wants to start raising capital,\" Clinton says.", "\"I think it'll be a very inviting platform for many First Nations businesses to be able to get the guidance and the support that they need.\"\u00a0", "Sobah is using the money raised through equity crowdfunding to build a brewery, which will triple the company's production. The business also plans to deliver a return to investors within five years.", "Tom Gunson is also positive about the future of crowd-sourced funding.\u00a0", "\"Crowd-sourced funding is a really great example of what we're going to need in the future, which is a community of solvers, coming together in different, unexpected ways to solve some of the world's biggest problems.\""]
